Articles.Content: I have had many broken planes hopelessly plummeting toward Kerbin, and I wished the Kerbals inside had EVA parachutes. Not the round parachutes, but the parachutes that most everyone uses anymore. I believe that type is a parafoil, right?
Like these? http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/23304-10vanguard-technologies-eva-parachutes-still-works/

Yes, I'd like this.  Not sure of the best way to implement it though. 

I guess it would be easiest to just have them included on the EVA jet pack and activate with a hot key or right click when needed.

Best Idea Ever:

MLG

PARACHUTE

STUNT

MONTAGE

I would like for this to be added.
Id actually love this.  Might finally wean me off the revert button.

im sure that the  EVA parachutes are very useful,at least when the plane breaks apart or the built in parachutes fail,at least the crew survives...

i support the idea

Edited December 22, 2015 by Shark4558
bad grammar,fixed.

It's a good idea but it can't be too op. I think this is not how a crash should go:

[Jeb] hey I'm losing control mission control

[gene] well try gaining control

[jeb] I can't I've lost a wing and I have no onboard parachutes

[if Eva parachutes get added] BAILOUT and he's safe

[if they dont] jeb tries to regain control and regains it.

Yeah but even for gameplay that panic moment when you're trying to decide if you can pull out or need to eject could make for a ton of fun. You'd just want the chutes to behave in a way that you needed sufficient time for them to deploy and slow down. You still lose the plane/rocket after all.

I would actually really love the Kerbals to have upgradable EVA suits, maybe depending on the Astronaut Complex's level.  We already have the player require upgrading it to do any EVA's at all, I wonder if that could be made more granular.  Presumably they could do EVAs at level zero as long as they are on Kerbin, but need to be at least level 1 to do it anywhere else.  Then maybe add lights, the jetpack, and a parachute as the complex levels up?
^All of that.

Id actually love this.  Might finally wean me off the revert button. 

 

I know last version I ran hardcore, no revert, no quicksaves, just vanguard EVA chutes.

 

I lost 2 Kerbals due to failures, 1 was because he ejected at mach 3, and well..... it is REALLY hard to keep with in 5km range of another Kerbal when that happens, so he was a loss.  The second was due to a damaged craft attempting to land.... the landing was going find till the wing snapped off and then the craft tumbled end over end down to the runway.   Took a while to gather up all the debri.

Instead of a useless SAS button on the EVA navball, you could replace it with ECD button, Emergency Chute Deploy. because seriously, it's surprising that the KSC hasn't been sued over Ejection deaths...
